snippet: The Cleveland police officer who fatally shot a 12-year-old boy last month left the force in nearby Independence, Ohio, after an internal assessment found that he had suffered a “dangerous loss of composure” during firearms training.
abstract: Cleveland Plain Dealer reports that Cleveland Police Officer Tim Loehmann, who fatally shot 12-year-old Tamir Rice in November, left neighboring police force in 2012 after a negative assessment of his performance during firearms training.
lead_paragraph: The Cleveland police officer who fatally shot a 12-year-old boy last month left the force in nearby Independence, Ohio, after an internal assessment found that he had suffered a “dangerous loss of composure” during firearms training.

headline.main: Ohio: Officer Who Killed Boy Had a Negative Firearms Review
